alert.note: Alert for Lee; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 1:24PM EDT until July 23 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Lee County in southwestern Georgia... East Central Terrell County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 124 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Leesburg, Dawson, Sasser, Neyami, Jordan Place, Starksville, Bridges Crossroad and Dawson Municipal A/P. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
